title: Stronghold Slayer Cave

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Stronghold Slayer Cave, also known as the Stronghold Slayer Dungeon, is a dungeon located beneath the Tree Gnome Stronghold. It contains a small variety of monsters that are commonly assigned to players. The cave entrance is located next to Nieve (or Steve, after the events of Monkey Madness II).

content:
Stronghold Slayer Cave
Released23 January 2014 (Update)
MembersYes
FloorsOne
LocationGnome Empire
InhabitantsVaries
MusicBeneath the Stronghold
Map
Advanced data
Typedungeon

The Stronghold Slayer Cave, also known as the Stronghold Slayer Dungeon, is a dungeon located beneath the Tree Gnome Stronghold. It contains a small variety of monsters that are commonly assigned to players. The cave entrance is located next to Nieve (or Steve, after the events of Monkey Madness II).

Anyone can enter the dungeon, but players can only attack the slayer monster they were assigned, and only while the task has not been completed. The slayer ring can teleport players to the entrance of the cave. A dwarf multicannon can be used in the dungeon.

There is a shortcut in the dungeon requiring 72 Agility (can be boosted) to use. This allows the player to reach Aberrant spectres and Ankous quicker. It may be used to exit the dungeon faster, but doing so without the required Agility level deals up to 12 damage.

Contents

  • 1 Location
  • 2 Monsters
  • 3 Development history
  • 4 Changes

Location[edit | edit source]

The cave's entrance is found next to Nieve.

The entrance to the Stronghold Slayer Cave is located in the Gnome Stronghold near Nieve, who is located just south-west of the Spirit Tree.

There are various ways to get there:

  • Use a Slayer ring to teleport directly to the entrance by Nieve.
  • Use the Gnome glider to Ta Quir Priw, which will take you to the Grand Tree. Exit the Grand Tree and run south-west to the entrance.
  • Use the Spirit tree to the Tree Gnome Stronghold and run south-west.
  • Use the Necklace of passage to Teleport to 'Outpost' and then run north-east.

Monsters[edit | edit source]

Monsters that can be found in the Stronghold Slayer Cave include:

Monster Image Combat level Slayer level Slayer XP Quantity
Aberrant spectre
96 60 90 13
Ankou
75, 82, 86 1 60, 65, 70 8
Bloodveld
76 50 120 12
Fire giant
86 1 111 12
Hellhound
122 1 116 13

Development history[edit | edit source]

A slayer dungeon containing a large variety of monsters where players can only attack their assigned slayer target was proposed in the Slayer & Christmas Dev Blog on 15 November 2013. The dungeon was polled in Content Poll #13 and passed by 86.6%.

A map of the Stronghold Slayer Cave upon release.

The cave was released on 23 January 2014, where it housed many common slayer monsters such as metal dragons, abyssal demons, and kalphites. However, the cave kraken lake was empty, as development of the slayer monster was not yet complete. This was added in an update a week later. The cave would go on to receive several more additions:

  • 10 April 2014 - Smoke devils and the Kraken boss were added.
  • 6 November 2014 - Gargoyles were added.
  • 17 September 2015 - Black demons, blue dragons, and black dragons were added.

  • The south-east area of the cave, where bloodvelds, hellhounds, and aberrant spectres could be found.

  • The south-east area of the cave, where waterfiends, abyssal demons, and nechryael could be found.

  • The volcanic area of the cave, where fire giants and various dragons could be found.

  • A kalphite habitat. The dead entomologist, Buggie, who brought them there, can be seen in the back.

  • The cave kraken lake, where many of them thrived.

  • A player fights a nuclear smoke devil while defending themselves against a horde of smoke devils.

  • The westernmost area of the cave, where black demons, blue dragons, and black dragons could be found.

  • A section of the Underground pass was visible from the south-east area of the cave.

Eventually, players began to voice concerns on the sheer amount of slayer assignments that they found themselves doing in the Stronghold Slayer Cave, due to its close proximity to a bank and convenient location, taking away the appeal of the variety the Slayer skill offers, the monotony of grinding in the same location, and the lack of exploring the game world as players train.

Players also complained that many of the monsters found there do not appear to be native to the area. In addition, the geography of the cave wildly varied, with damp caves on the east and lava lakes a small walk west, breaking the sense of immersion. Additional concerns included the excessively large size of the cave, which was large enough to fit Falador, Varrock, and everything between them.

In response, the Old School team wrote a Developer Blog, aiming to bring back the variety and diversity of where players train Slayer by moving some creatures out of the Stronghold Slayer Cave, and placing them into a number other new dungeons where appropriate (still requiring the appropriate slayer assignment to attack them). The cave's splitting was polled in Content Poll #51 and passed by 89.6%.

A map of the Stronghold Slayer Cave before the update that split it.

As a result, the cave was completely remapped on 27 April 2017, leaving only bloodvelds, hellhounds, aberrant spectres, ankou, and fire giants behind. The cave became nearly one-fifth its original size, with the following new areas introduced with monsters relocated to them:

  • Greater and black demons were relocated to the new Chasm of Fire in Shayzien.
  • Black dragons, their babies, and blue dragons were relocated to a new upper level within Taverley Dungeon.
  • Gargoyles, nechryael, and abyssal demons were relocated to the new basement within the Slayer Tower.
  • The metal dragons were relocated to a new cave west of the pre-existing cave that housed iron and steel dragons in the Brimhaven Dungeon.
  • The kalphites were moved to the new Kalphite Cave east of the Shantay Pass.
  • The smoke devils were moved to the new Smoke Devil Dungeon south of Castle Wars.
  • The waterfiends and cave kraken were moved to the new Kraken Cove south-west of the Piscatoris Fishing Colony.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
27 April 2017
(update | poll)

Many of the monsters in the Stronghold Slayer Cave have been removed and the size of the cave has been greatly reduced. The removed monster have been relocated to various other task-only areas.

15 September 2015
(update | poll)

The Stronghold Slayer Cave has been expanded further west, and black demons, black dragons and blue dragons have been added to this new section.

6 November 2014
(update | poll)

Gargoyles have been added to the Stronghold Slayer Cave.

16 October 2014
(update)

Fixed a tile within the Kalphite area of the Stronghold Slayer Cave that allowed you to fight them off task.

22 May 2014
(update | poll)

Players can now permanently dismiss the warnings that are shown before entering the rooms of the cave kraken and smoke devil bosses.

10 April 2014
(update | poll)
  • Smoke devils, requiring level 93 Slayer, have been added to the Stronghold Slayer Cave along with their boss variant, the Thermonuclear Smoke Devil.
  • The Kraken boss variant has been added to the Cave kraken area of the cave.
30 January 2014
(update | poll)

Cave krakens, requiring level 87 Slayer, have been added to the Stronghold Slayer Cave.

The '''Stronghold Slayer Cave''', also known as the '''Stronghold Slayer Dungeon''', is a dungeon located beneath the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]]. It contains a small variety of monsters that are commonly [[Slayer task|assigned]] to players. The cave entrance is located next to [[Nieve]] (or [[Steve]], after the events of [[Monkey Madness II]]).

Anyone can enter the dungeon, but players can only attack the [[slayer monster]] they were assigned, and only while the task has not been completed. The [[slayer ring]] can teleport players to the entrance of the cave. A [[dwarf multicannon]] can be used in the dungeon.

There is a [[shortcut]] in the dungeon requiring 72 [[Agility]] (can be boosted) to use. This allows the player to reach [[Aberrant spectre]]s and [[Ankou]]s quicker. It may be used to exit the dungeon faster, but doing so without the required Agility level deals up to 12 damage.
{{ToC}}
==Location==
[[File:Stronghold Slayer Cave entrance.png|thumb|right|The cave's entrance is found next to Nieve.]]
The entrance to the Stronghold Slayer Cave is located in the [[Gnome Stronghold]] near [[Nieve]], who is located just south-west of the [[Spirit Tree]].

There are various ways to get there:
*Use a [[Slayer ring]] to teleport directly to the entrance by [[Nieve]].
*Use the [[Gnome glider]] to ''Ta Quir Priw'', which will take you to the [[Grand Tree]]. Exit the Grand Tree and run south-west to the entrance.
*Use the [[Spirit tree]] to the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] and run south-west.
*Use the [[Necklace of passage]] to Teleport to 'Outpost' and then run north-east.

==Monsters==
Monsters that can be found in the Stronghold Slayer Cave include:

==Development history==
A slayer dungeon containing a large variety of monsters where players can only attack their assigned slayer target was proposed in the {{UD|Slayer & Christmas Dev Blog}} on [[15 November]] [[2013]]. The dungeon was polled in Content Poll #13 and passed by 86.6%.

[[File:Stronghold Slayer Cave map release.png|thumb|350px|A map of the Stronghold Slayer Cave upon release.]]
The cave was released on [[23 January]] [[2014]], where it housed many common slayer monsters such as [[metal dragons]], [[abyssal demon]]s, and [[kalphite]]s. However, the cave kraken lake was empty, as development of the slayer monster was not yet complete. This was added in an {{UD|Release the Kraken!|update}} a week later. The cave would go on to receive several more additions:
*[[Update:Easter & Slayer Updates|10 April 2014]] - Smoke devils and the Kraken boss were added.
*[[Update:Amulet of the Damned & CWA|6 November 2014]] - Gargoyles were added.
*[[Update:Angler's Outfit & Slayer|17 September 2015]] - Black demons, blue dragons, and black dragons were added.

<gallery captionalign="center" widths="150">
Stronghold Slayer Cave - north-east area.png|The south-east area of the cave, where [[bloodveld]]s, [[hellhounds]], and [[aberrant spectre]]s could be found.
Stronghold Slayer Cave - south-east area.png|The south-east area of the cave, where [[waterfiend]]s, [[abyssal demons]], and [[nechryael]] could be found.
Stronghold Slayer Cave - lava area.png|The volcanic area of the cave, where [[fire giant]]s and various [[Dragon (race)|dragons]] could be found.
Kalphite Cave.png|A [[kalphite]] habitat. The dead [[entomologist]], Buggie, who brought them there, can be seen in the back.
Stronghold Slayer Cave - cave kraken lake.png|The [[cave kraken]] lake, where many of them thrived.
Stronghold Slayer Cave - smoke devil's den.png|A player fights a [[nuclear smoke devil]] while defending themselves against a horde of [[smoke devil]]s.
Stronghold Slayer Cave - western area.png|The westernmost area of the cave, where [[black demons]], [[blue dragon]]s, and [[black dragon]]s could be found.
Stronghold Slayer Cave - Underground Pass.png|A section of the [[Underground Pass (dungeon)|Underground pass]] was visible from the south-east area of the cave.
</gallery>

Eventually, players began to voice concerns on the sheer amount of slayer assignments that they found themselves doing in the Stronghold Slayer Cave, due to its close proximity to a bank and convenient location, taking away the appeal of the variety the Slayer skill offers, the monotony of grinding in the same location, and the lack of exploring the game world as players train.

Players also complained that many of the monsters found there do not appear to be native to the area. In addition, the geography of the cave wildly varied, with damp caves on the east and lava lakes a small walk west, breaking the sense of immersion. Additional concerns included the excessively large size of the cave, which was large enough to fit [[Falador]], [[Varrock]], and everything between them.

In response, the Old School team wrote a {{UD|Dev Blog: Slayer & Dungeons|Developer Blog}}, aiming to bring back the variety and diversity of where players train Slayer by moving some creatures out of the Stronghold Slayer Cave, and placing them into a number other new dungeons where appropriate (still requiring the appropriate slayer assignment to attack them). The cave's splitting was polled in Content Poll #51 and passed by 89.6%.

[[File:Stronghold Slayer Cave map pre-split.png|thumb|350px|A map of the Stronghold Slayer Cave before the update that split it.]]
As a result, the cave was completely remapped on {{UD|Diverse Dungeons|27 April 2017}}, leaving only [[bloodveld]]s, [[hellhound]]s, [[aberrant spectre]]s, [[ankou]], and [[fire giants]] behind. The cave became nearly one-fifth its original size, with the following new areas introduced with monsters relocated to them:
*[[Greater demon|Greater]] and [[black demon]]s were relocated to the new [[Chasm of Fire]] in [[Shayzien]].
*[[Black dragon]]s, their [[Baby black dragon|babies]], and [[blue dragon]]s were relocated to a new upper level within [[Taverley Dungeon]].
*[[Gargoyle]]s, [[nechryael]], and [[abyssal demon]]s were relocated to the new basement within the [[Slayer Tower]].
*The [[metal dragons]] were relocated to a new cave west of the pre-existing cave that housed [[Iron dragon|iron]] and [[steel dragon]]s in the [[Brimhaven Dungeon]].
*The [[kalphites]] were moved to the new [[Kalphite Cave]] east of the [[Shantay Pass]].
*The [[smoke devil]]s were moved to the new [[Smoke Devil Dungeon]] south of [[Castle Wars]].
*The [[waterfiend]]s and [[cave kraken]] were moved to the new [[Kraken Cove]] south-west of the [[Piscatoris Fishing Colony]].
